titleStmt.title: A letter sent out of Ireland to one Mr. Bell a merchant at this time living in St. Thomas Apostles : being a true relation of the present estate of Ireland as it now stands under the present persecution of the papists : also their carriage towards Dublin an their cruell and most ty [sic] tyrnnicall buring of Armath : sent over by a gentleman from Ireland unto a worthy merchant of this citie in a letter : the which letter was openly read on Friday last upon the Royall Exchange in London, and the contents confirmed by a gentleman who but lately arrived from Ireland and was spectator of most of those bloody and tragicall proceedings.
titleStmt.author: Farmer, Jacob, 17th cent.

notesStmt.note: Dated on p. 7 "Jan. 9, 1642" and signed Jacob Farmer.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
